channel.title: Fathers Day plans posting here!
channel.description:
hey guys, what is everyone doing for Fathers Day? Im just visiting having a nice dinner at Texas Roadhouse, haha- what is everyone in the community doing? Somthing special? Post it here :D!
(Message out to Ruby's father)
[quote="Ruby"]Dad's in afghan at the moment, isn't home until the 1st of August but will more than certainly be going for a run/training session/sauna/food and a pint when he's back for it.[/quote] I idolize your father then. It is a huge insperation that your dad is serving for this country :) tell him i say thank you when he gets back! I idolize him and honor him. My brother just went into National Guards boot camp and i myself am going into the Marines when i am of age, Once again, please tell your dad Ryan Barnhill honors him and i idolize him for what he is doing :)!!!

item.title: Fathers Day plans posting here!
item.dc:creator: @krackkid Krackkid
item.description:
@krackkid wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:25, topic:521890”][quote author=Krackkid link=topic=640400.msg4315804#msg4315804 date=1371469153]

Dad’s in afghan at the moment, isn’t home until the 1st of August but will more than certainly be going for a run/training session/sauna/food and a pint when he’s back for it.

I idolize your father then. It is a huge insperation that your dad is serving for this country tell him i say thank you when he gets back! I idolize him and honor him. My brother just went into National Guards boot camp and i myself am going into the Marines when i am of age, Once again, please tell your dad Ryan Barnhill honors him and i idolize him for what he is doing :)!!!
[/quote]You do know 1. He isn’t an American and 2. His father actually is fighting against the USA. Thought you should know that.

Scottish > American and where the love did you pull 2 from? He works for an american company helping train NDS/QRF, runs workshops fixing their vehicles and teaches afghans how to run a business. In no way shape or form is he fighting against americans. He’s actually stationed in Kaf in Kandahar which is an american base, lol.[/quote]Of course he works for an American company, as a spy! You scottish people and yourdrunken trickery.

item.title: Fathers Day plans posting here!
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“Krackkid, post:22, topic:521890”][quote author=FromAutumnToAshes link=topic=640400.msg4315656#msg4315656 date=1371437160]

Dad’s in afghan at the moment, isn’t home until the 1st of August but will more than certainly be going for a run/training session/sauna/food and a pint when he’s back for it.

I idolize your father then. It is a huge insperation that your dad is serving for this country tell him i say thank you when he gets back! I idolize him and honor him. My brother just went into National Guards boot camp and i myself am going into the Marines when i am of age, Once again, please tell your dad Ryan Barnhill honors him and i idolize him for what he is doing :)!!!
[/quote]You do know 1. He isn’t an American and 2. His father actually is fighting against the USA. Thought you should know that.[/quote]
Scottish > American and where the love did you pull 2 from? He works for an american company helping train NDS/QRF, runs workshops fixing their vehicles and teaches afghans how to run a business. In no way shape or form is he fighting against americans. He’s actually stationed in Kaf in Kandahar which is an american base, lol.

@FATA, he doesn’t serve his country in any way shape or form, he’s only out there for the money side of it which is completely acceptable since he does what he does to give a better life to my family (not so much me now that I’m full time employed) but it still puts a roof over my head. If I had the chance I’d be out there too.

Read full topic
